title: Section 1 - Title and Extent of the Code
content: This section provides the official title of the law - 'The Indian Penal Code' - and specifies its geographical extent of application across the territory of India, unless otherwise specified by law.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 2 - Punishment of Offences Committed Within India
content: This section establishes the principle of territorial jurisdiction. It states that every person shall be liable to punishment under the Code for any act or omission contrary to its provisions, committed within India.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific offence committed

title: Section 3 - Punishment of Offences Committed Beyond, But Which by Law May Be Tried Within India
content: This section extends the Code's jurisdiction to offences committed by any person beyond the borders of India, which by Indian law can be tried within India.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific offence committed

title: Section 4 - Extension of Code to Extra-Territorial Offences
content: This section elaborates on Section 3, specifying that the Code applies to any citizen of India anywhere in the world, any person on a ship or aircraft registered in India, and any person targeting a computer resource in India.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific offence committed

title: Section 5 - Certain Laws Not to Be Affected by This Act
content: This section clarifies that the IPC does not repeal other special or local laws. It states that the provisions of the IPC are in addition to, and not in derogation of, any other law in force.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 6 - Definitions in the Code to Be Understood Subject to Exceptions
content: This section is an interpretive rule. It states that every definition of an offence, every penal provision, and every illustration in the Code shall be understood subject to the general exceptions contained in Chapters IV (Sections 76-106).. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 7 - Sense of Expression Once Explained
content: This section states that every expression which is explained in any part of the Code is to be used in the same sense throughout the Code, unless the context indicates otherwise.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 8 - Gender
content: This section clarifies that unless the context suggests otherwise, the pronoun 'he' and its derivatives (him, his) used in the Code refer to any person, whether male, female, or a non-binary individual.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 9 - Number
content: This section states that unless the context indicates otherwise, words in the singular include the plural, and words in the plural include the singular.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 10 - Man / Woman
content: This section defines the terms 'man' and 'woman'. It states that the word 'man' denotes a male human being of any age, and the word 'woman' denotes a female human being of any age.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 11 - Person
content: This section defines the term 'person'. It includes any company, association, or body of persons, whether incorporated or not. This allows for corporate criminal liability.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific offence committed (often a fine)

title: Section 12 - Public
content: This section defines the word 'public' as including any class of the public or any community.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 13 - Queen
content: [Repealed] This section, which originally referred to the British monarch, has been omitted from the Code.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 14 - Servant of Government
content: This section defines who is considered a 'servant of Government' or a 'public servant'. It includes officials like judges, military personnel, police officers, and any officer whose duty is to prevent offences, etc.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 15 - British India
content: [Repealed] This section, which defined the territories of British India, has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 16 - Government of India
content: [Repealed] This section, which referred to the British government, has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 17 - Government
content: This section defines 'Government' as referring to the Central Government or the Government of a State within the Republic of India.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 18 - India
content: This section defines 'India' as the territory of India, excluding the state of Jammu and Kashmir (note: this was pre-2019; post Article 370 abrogation, the IPC applies fully to J&K).. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 19 - Judge
content: This section provides a detailed definition of a 'Judge'. It includes not only every person who is officially designated as a Judge but also any person who is empowered by law to give a definitive judgment in any legal proceeding.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 20 - Court of Justice
content: This section defines a 'Court of Justice' as a judge or body of judges empowered by law to act judicially. It can be a single judge and does not require a formal courtroom.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 21 - Public Servant
content: This section provides an exhaustive list of who is considered a 'public servant'. It includes government officials, judges, officers of the armed forces, police, jurors, and any person holding office to perform a public duty.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 22 - Movable Property
content: This section defines 'movable property' as including corporeal property of every description (physical objects), except land and things attached to the earth or permanently fastened to anything attached to the earth.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 23 - Wrongful Gain
content: This section defines 'wrongful gain' as gain by unlawful means of property to which the person gaining it is not legally entitled.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 24 - Wrongful Loss
content: This section defines 'wrongful loss' as the loss by unlawful means of property to which the person losing it is legally entitled.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 25 - Dishonestly
content: This section defines the mental state of acting 'dishonestly'. A person acts dishonestly if they do something with the intention of causing wrongful gain to one person or wrongful loss to another person.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of an offence)

title: Section 26 - Fraudulently
content: This section defines the mental state of acting 'fraudulently'. A person acts fraudulently if they intend to defraud by deceiving another person. The intent to deceive is key.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of an offence)

title: Section 27 - Property in Possession of Wife, Clerk or Servant
content: This section states that when property is in the possession of a person's wife, clerk, or servant, on that person's account, the property is deemed to be in that person's possession.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 28 - Counterfeit
content: This section defines what it means to 'counterfeit'. A person is said to counterfeit who causes one thing to resemble another thing, intending to use it for deception or knowing it is likely to be used for deception.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of an offence)

title: Section 29 - Document
content: This section defines a 'document' very broadly. It denotes any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters, figures, or marks, intended to be used as evidence of that matter.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 29A - Electronic Record
content: This section defines 'Electronic Record' as data, record, or data generated, image or sound stored, received or sent in an electronic form.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 30 - Valuable Security
content: This section defines a 'valuable security' as a document that creates, extends, transfers, restricts, extinguishes, or releases any legal right, or which gives anyone a legal right to anything.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 31 - A Will
content: This section defines a 'Will' as any testamentary document, meaning any document that outlines how a person's property is to be distributed after their death.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 32 - Words Referring to Acts Include Illegal Omissions
content: This section states that throughout the Code, every word which refers to an 'act' done, also applies to an 'illegal omission' (a failure to perform a legal duty), unless the context suggests otherwise.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 33 - Act / Omission
content: This section defines an 'act' as a single bodily movement and a series of bodily movements. It defines an 'omission' as a failure to perform a bodily movement one is legally obliged to perform.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 34 - Acts Done by Several Persons in Furtherance of Common Intention
content: This section establishes the principle of joint liability. When a criminal act is done by several people in furtherance of a common intention, each person is liable for that act as if it were done by them alone.. Punishment: Each person is liable for the punishment of the offence committed.

title: Section 35 - When Such an Act is Criminal by Reason of its Being Done With a Criminal Knowledge or Intention
content: This section distinguishes offences that require a general criminal intention (mens rea) from those that require a specific intention. Liability depends on the intention or knowledge of the individual.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific intention proved

title: Section 36 - Effect Caused Partly by Act and Partly by Omission
content: This section states that wherever the causing of a certain effect is an offence, it is immaterial whether the effect was caused by an act, by an omission, or partly by act and partly by omission.. Punishment: Punishment as per the specific offence committed

title: Section 37 - Co-operation by Doing One of Several Acts Constituting an Offence
content: This section states that when an offence is committed by several acts, whoever intentionally co-operates in the commission of that offence by doing any one of those acts is considered to have committed the offence.. Punishment: Punishment as for the offence committed

title: Section 38 - Persons Concerned in Criminal Act May Be Guilty of Different Offences
content: This section clarifies that where several people are engaged in a criminal act, they may each be guilty of different offences based on their individual intentions and actions.. Punishment: Punishment as per the individual offence committed

title: Section 39 - Voluntarily
content: This section defines the key term 'voluntarily'. A person is said to cause an effect 'voluntarily' when they cause it by means whereby they intended to cause it, or by means which they knew were likely to cause it.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of an offence)

title: Section 40 - Offence
content: This section defines the term 'Offence'. It denotes a thing made punishable by the Indian Penal Code. In subsequent parts of the Code, it is also used to denote a thing punishable under a special or local law.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 41 - Special Law
content: This section defines a 'Special Law' as a law applicable to a particular subject, class, or area, as opposed to a general law like the IPC.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 42 - Local Law
content: This section defines a 'Local Law' as a law applicable only to a specific part of India.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 43 - Illegal / Legally Bound to Do
content: This section defines 'illegal'. It applies to everything which is an offence, or which is prohibited by law, or which furnishes ground for a civil lawsuit. It also defines 'legally bound to do' as anything the law requires to be done.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 44 - Injury
content: This section defines 'injury' very broadly. It denotes any harm whatever illegally caused to any person, in body, mind, reputation, or property.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 45 - Life
content: This section defines 'Life' as the life of a human being, unless the context indicates otherwise. This definition is crucial for offences against the human body.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 46 - Death
content: This section defines 'Death' as the death of a human being.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 47 - Animal
content: This section defines 'Animal' as any living creature other than a human being.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 48 - Vessel
content: This section defines 'Vessel' as anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or property. This includes everything from a large ship to a small boat.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 49 - Year / Month
content: This section states that wherever the word 'year' or 'month' is used, it is to be understood according to the British Gregorian calendar. A 'year' means 12 months, a 'month' means 30 days.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 50 - Section
content: This section states that the word 'section' refers to a section of the Indian Penal Code itself. The word is to be understood in this sense throughout the Code.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 51 - Oath
content: This section defines the term 'oath' to include a solemn affirmation and every declaration mandated by law where an person is bound to tell the truth. This is crucial for offences related to false evidence.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 52 - Good Faith
content: This is a vital defensive concept. An thing is said to be done or believed in 'good faith' if it is done with due care and attention. Mere carelessness is not good faith; honesty of purpose must be accompanied by diligence.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Often a defense)

title: Section 53 - Punishment
content: This section defines 'punishment' under the IPC. The punishments to which offenders are liable are: Death, Imprisonment for life (as defined in S.55), Imprisonment (rigorous or simple), Forfeiture of property, and Fine.. Punishment: As per the specific section: Death, Imprisonment, Fine, Forfeiture

title: Section 53A - Construction of reference to transportation
content: [Repealed] This section, which dealt with the punishment of transportation, has been omitted as the punishment is no longer awarded.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 54 - Commutation of sentence of death
content: This section states that the appropriate Government has the power to commute a sentence of death to any other punishment authorized by the IPC.. Punishment: N/A (Procedural)

title: Section 55 - Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
content: This section states that the appropriate Government has the power to commute a sentence of imprisonment for life to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years or to a fine.. Punishment: N/A (Procedural)

title: Section 55A - Definition of appropriate Government
content: This section defines 'appropriate Government' for the purposes of Sections 54 and 55. It means the Central Government for cases investigated by Delhi Special Police Establishment (CBI) or under a Central Act, and the State Government in other cases.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 56 - Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude
content: [Repealed] This racially discriminatory section has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 57 - Fractions of terms of punishment
content: This section provides a rule of calculation: when calculating a fraction of a term of imprisonment, imprisonment for life shall be reckoned as equivalent to imprisonment for twenty years. This is for calculation purposes only and does not mean a life sentence is 20 years.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Calculation Rule)

title: Section 58 - Offenders sentenced to transportation how dealt with until transported
content: [Repealed] This section has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 59 - Transportation instead of imprisonment
content: [Repealed] This section has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 60 - Sentence may be (in certain cases of imprisonment) wholly or partly rigorous or simple
content: This section grants courts the discretion to declare whether a sentence of imprisonment shall be rigorous (involving hard labour) or simple, or that part shall be one and part the other.. Punishment: Imprisonment (Rigorous/Simple)

title: Section 61 - Sentence of forfeiture of property
content: [Repealed] This section, which provided for the sentence of forfeiture of property, has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 62 - Forfeiture of property in respect of offenders punishable with death
content: [Repealed] This section has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 63 - Amount of fine
content: This section states that when no sum is expressed to which a fine may extend, the amount of fine that may be imposed is unlimited, but it shall not be excessive.. Punishment: Fine (amount at court's discretion)

title: Section 64 - Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
content: This section allows a court to impose a term of imprisonment in default of payment of a fine. This imprisonment is in addition to a substantive sentence of imprisonment for the offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment in default of fine (in addition to main punishment)

title: Section 65 - Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine, when imprisonment and fine awardable
content: This section limits the term of imprisonment in default of fine. It must not exceed one-fourth of the maximum term of imprisonment fixed for the offence by the Code.. Punishment: Imprisonment not exceeding 1/4th of the maximum term for the offence

title: Section 66 - Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
content: This section states that the imprisonment awarded in default of payment of a fine shall be simple imprisonment.. Punishment: Simple Imprisonment

title: Section 67 - Imprisonment for non-payment of fine, when offence punishable with fine only
content: If the offence is punishable with fine only, the imprisonment in default of payment can be simple, and the term is limited by a scale based on the fine amount (e.g., up to 2 months for a fine of Rs. 50).. Punishment: Simple Imprisonment (as per scale in the section)

title: Section 68 - Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
content: This section states that the imprisonment in default of paying a fine shall terminate whenever the fine is paid.. Punishment: N/A (Procedural)

title: Section 69 - Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
content: If a fine is imposed with an alternative imprisonment and the fine is not paid, any part of the imprisonment already undergone shall be credited against the fine at a proportional rate.. Punishment: N/A (Procedural)

title: Section 70 - Fine leviable within six years, or during imprisonment—Death not to discharge property from liability
content: This section sets a six-year time limit for executing a fine (like recovering a debt). It also states that the death of the offender does not discharge their property from liability for the fine.. Punishment: N/A (Limitation & Liability)

title: Section 71 - Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
content: Where an act constitutes multiple offences, or where a single act is both an offence itself and part of a larger offence, the offender cannot be punished more than once. They shall be punished for the offence which provides the greater punishment.. Punishment: Punishment for the graver offence only

title: Section 72 - Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences, the judgment stating that it is doubtful of which
content: In a case where it is doubtful which of several offences the facts prove, the offender shall be punished for the offence for which the lowest punishment is provided.. Punishment: Punishment for the offence with the lowest penalty

title: Section 73 - Solitary confinement
content: This section regulates the imposition of solitary confinement. It can only be imposed as part of a rigorous imprisonment sentence. Its duration must not exceed three months in total, with specific limits based on the sentence length.. Punishment: Solitary Confinement (subject to limits in S.73, S.74)

title: Section 74 - Limit of solitary confinement
content: This section provides the precise limits: solitary confinement shall not exceed fourteen days at a time, with intervals of at least fourteen days between each period, and shall not exceed three months in total.. Punishment: Solitary Confinement (as per the specified limits)

title: Section 75 - Enhanced punishment for certain offences under Chapter XII or Chapter XVII after previous conviction
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment for a person who, having been previously convicted of an offence under Chapter XII (Offences against property) or Chapter XVII (Offences against property), is again convicted of any such offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment which may extend to ten years (for the specific repeat offence)

title: Section 76 - Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law
content: This is the first General Exception. It excuses an act done by a person who is, or who by a mistake of fact believes themselves to be, bound by law to do it.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 77 - Act of Judge when acting judicially
content: This General Exception protects a Judge acting in their judicial capacity, provided they believe in good faith that they have jurisdiction to act.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 78 - Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
content: This General Exception protects any person who executes a Court's judgment or order, even if the Court later turns out to have no jurisdiction, provided the person executing it believed in good faith the Court had jurisdiction.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 79 - Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law
content: This General Exception excuses an act done by anyone who is justified by law, or who by a mistake of fact (not mistake of law) believes themselves to be justified by law, in doing it.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 80 - Accident in doing a lawful act
content: This General Exception excuses an act that is accidental and occurs while doing a lawful act, in a lawful manner, by lawful means, and with proper care and caution.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 81 - Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm
content: This General Exception excuses an act not intended to cause harm, and done to prevent or avoid harm to person or property, provided the harm caused is proportionate.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 82 - Act of a child under seven years of age
content: This General Exception provides absolute immunity from criminal liability for a child under seven years of age, due to a presumption of incapacity to form criminal intent (doli incapax).. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 83 - Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
content: This General Exception provides immunity for a child between seven and twelve years of age if they have not attained sufficient maturity of understanding to judge the nature and consequences of their conduct.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 84 - Act of a person of unsound mind
content: This General Exception excuses an act done by a person who, at the time of doing it, was incapable of knowing the nature of the act or that it was wrong or contrary to law, due to unsoundness of mind.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 85 - Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
content: This General Exception excuses an act done by an intoxicated person, provided the intoxication was caused without their will or knowledge (e.g., forced, drugged, or deceived).. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 86 - Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
content: This section qualifies S.85. Voluntary intoxication does not excuse an offence. However, if an offence requires a specific intent (e.g., murder requires intent to kill), the court can consider whether the intoxication prevented the formation of that specific intent.. Punishment: Punishment for the offence (but intent may be negated for specific intent crimes)

title: Section 87 - Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent
content: This General Exception excuses an act not intended to cause death or grievous hurt, done with the consent of the victim (express or implied), even if it causes harm.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 88 - Act not intended to cause death, done by consent in good faith for person's benefit
content: This General Exception excuses an act done in good faith for the benefit of a person, even without their consent, provided it does not intend to cause death and the person cannot give consent. A surgeon performing an operation is protected.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 89 - Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person, by or by consent of guardian
content: This General Exception excuses an act done in good faith for the benefit of a child under 12 or a person of unsound mind, by their guardian or with the guardian's consent, provided it is not intended to cause death or grievous hurt.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 90 - Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
content: This section defines what is *not* valid consent. Consent is not valid if given under fear of injury, misconception of fact, by a person of unsound mind, or by a child under 12 unless given by their guardian.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - vitiates consent)

title: Section 91 - Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused
content: The exceptions in S.87, S.88, and S.89 do not apply to acts that are offences by themselves, regardless of whether they cause harm or are done with consent.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Limits exceptions)

title: Section 92 - Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
content: This General Exception excuses an act done in good faith for the benefit of a person without their consent, where it is impossible to obtain consent and the act does not intend to cause death.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 93 - Communication made in good faith
content: This General Exception excuses a communication made in good faith for the benefit of the person it is made to. It protects advice given honestly, even if it turns out to be harmful.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 94 - Act to which a person is compelled by threats
content: This General Exception excuses an act (other than murder and offences against the state punishable with death) done under threats that reasonably cause apprehension of instant death. The threat must be present and immediate.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception) (Except for murder and certain state offences)

title: Section 95 - Act causing slight harm
content: This General Exception states that nothing is an offence which causes, or intends to cause, harm so slight that no person of ordinary sense and temper would complain of it. This is the doctrine of de minimis non curat lex (the law does not concern itself with trifles).. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 96 - Things done in private defence
content: This section introduces the right of private defence. Nothing is an offence which is done in the exercise of the right of private defence. This right is detailed in the following sections.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 97 - Right of private defence of the body and of property
content: This section specifies the two aspects of the right: 1) the right to defend one's own body or another's body against any offence affecting the human body; 2) the right to defend one's own property or another's property against certain offences like theft, robbery, mischief, or criminal trespass.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 98 - Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind, etc.
content: This section states that the right of private defence exists even against an act of a person who, due to youth, unsoundness of mind, intoxication, or a mistake of fact, is not legally guilty of an offence. You can defend yourself against a harmful act even if the attacker is not criminally liable.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 99 - Acts against which there is no right of private defence
content: This section limits the right of private defence. There is no right: 1) against an act done by a public servant in good faith under colour of their office; 2) against an act done under the direction of a public servant; 3) where there is time to seek public authorities; 4) the force used must not be more than necessary.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Limits the right)

title: Section 100 - When the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death
content: This section specifies the extreme circumstances where the right of private defence of the body extends to voluntarily causing death or any other harm to the assailant. These include fear of death, grievous hurt, rape, unnatural lust, kidnapping, or abduction.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 101 - When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
content: This section acts as the default rule for the right of private defence of the body. If the circumstances do not fall under the extreme categories listed in S.100, the right of private defence still exists, but it does not extend to voluntarily causing death. It only extends to causing any harm short of death.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception - if force is justified)

title: Section 102 - Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
content: This section defines the duration of the right of private defence of the body. The right commences as soon as a reasonable apprehension of danger to the body arises from an attempt or threat, and it continues as long as such apprehension of danger to the body persists.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Temporal Scope)

title: Section 103 - When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
content: This section specifies the extreme circumstances where the right of private defence of property extends to voluntarily causing death. These include robbery, house-breaking by night, mischief by fire to a building (arson), or theft/mischief under such circumstances that may reasonably cause apprehension that death or grievous hurt will be the consequence if the right is not exercised.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 104 - When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
content: This section is the default rule for the right of private defence of property. If the circumstances do not fall under the extreme categories in S.103, the right still exists but only extends to causing any harm other than death.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception - if force is justified)

title: Section 105 - Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
content: This section defines the duration of the right of private defence of property. The right against theft continues until the offender has retreated with the property or until public authorities take charge. The right against criminal trespass or mischief continues as long as the offender continues in the act of trespass or mischief.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Temporal Scope)

title: Section 106 - Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person
content: This section addresses a complex scenario. If an right of private defence against an assault likely to cause death exists, but exercising that right risks harming an innocent person, the right still exists even if that harm is caused.. Punishment: No Punishment (Exception)

title: Section 107 - Abetment of a thing
content: This section defines the key term 'Abetment'. A person abets the doing of a thing if they: 1) Instigate another to do it; or 2) Engage with one or more persons in a conspiracy to do it; or 3) Intentionally aid the doing of that thing.. Punishment: Punishment as per the offence abetted (S.109)

title: Section 108 - Abettor
content: This section defines an 'Abettor'. A person abets an offence if they abet either the commission of an offence or the commission of an act which would be an offence if committed by a person capable of committing an offence. The abettor need not be present at the scene of the crime.. Punishment: Punishment as per the offence abetted

title: Section 108A - Abetment in India of offences outside India
content: This section extends liability for abetment. A person abets an offence outside India which is also an offence under the Indian Penal Code is guilty of abetting that offence, and can be tried in India.. Punishment: Punishment as per the offence abetted

title: Section 109 - Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence and where no express provision is made for its punishment
content: This is a fundamental punishment section for abetment. If the act abetted is committed as a consequence of the abetment, and no specific punishment for the abetment is provided, the abetment is punished with the punishment provided for the original offence.. Punishment: Punishment provided for the offence committed

title: Section 110 - Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention from that of abettor
content: This section holds an abettor liable for the act committed, even if the person abetted acts with a different intention or knowledge from that of the abettor. The act done is considered a consequence of the abetment.. Punishment: Punishment provided for the offence committed

title: Section 111 - Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
content: This section states that if the act done is a probable consequence of the abetment and differs from the act abetted, the abettor is liable for the act done in the same manner as if they had abetted that actual act.. Punishment: Punishment provided for the offence actually committed

title: Section 112 - Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done
content: If an act for which the abettor is liable under S.111 is itself an offence, and the abettor is also liable under another section for abetting a different offence, they may receive cumulative punishment for both.. Punishment: Cumulative punishment as per the two offences

title: Section 113 - Liability of abettor for an effect caused by the act abetted different from that intended by the abettor
content: This section makes an abettor liable for an effect caused by the act abetted that is different from what they intended, provided the act done was a likely consequence of the abetment.. Punishment: Punishment provided for the offence caused

title: Section 114 - Abettor present when offence is committed
content: This section creates a harsher presumption. Whenever any person who if absent would be liable to be punished as an abettor, is present when the offence is committed, they are deemed to have committed the offence itself.. Punishment: Punishment provided for the offence committed

title: Section 115 - Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life—if offence not committed
content: This section punishes the abetment of specific serious offences (punishable with death or life imprisonment) even if the offence is not committed or is only committed in part. If no express provision exists, the abettor can be imprisoned for up to 7 years and also fined.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

title: Section 116 - Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment—if offence not committed
content: This section punishes the abetment of any offence punishable with imprisonment, even if the offence is not committed. If the abettor is a public servant whose duty is to prevent the offence, the punishment is more severe.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to one-fourth of the maximum for the offence, or fine, or both (more if public servant)

title: Section 117 - Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
content: This section punishes abetment of an offence by the public generally or by any number of persons exceeding ten. It targets those who incite mobs or large groups to commit crimes.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 118 - Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life
content: This section punishes a person who, knowing a design to commit an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment, intentionally conceals that design or fails to inform the authorities. It requires the offence to not have been committed.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 119 - Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is their duty to prevent
content: This section is a stricter version of S.118 for public servants. If a public servant, knowing a design to commit any offence (not just serious ones) which they have a duty to prevent, conceals it, they are punishable.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to one-half the maximum for the offence, or fine, or both

title: Section 120 - Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
content: This section punishes the concealment of a design to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, if that offence is committed. If the offence is not committed, the punishment is lower.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to one-fourth the maximum for the offence, or fine, or both (lesser if offence not committed)

title: Section 120A - Definition of criminal conspiracy
content: This section defines 'criminal conspiracy'. It is an agreement between two or more persons to do an illegal act, or to do a legal act by illegal means. Mere agreement is enough; no overt act needs to be taken in furtherance of the agreement.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.120B

title: Section 120B - Punishment of criminal conspiracy
content: This section punishes criminal conspiracy. If the subject of the conspiracy is a serious offence (punishable with death, life imprisonment, or rigorous imprisonment for 2+ years), the punishment is the same as for abetting that offence. For other conspiracies, the punishment is imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.. Punishment: Same as abetment of that offence; or up to 6 months imprisonment/fine for other offences

title: Section 121 - Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against the Government of India
content: This is one of the most serious offences against the state. It involves waging war, attempting to wage war, or abetting the waging of war against the Government of India. This implies a concerted, violent uprising.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life and fine

title: Section 121A - Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by Section 121
content: This section specifically punishes conspiracy to commit any of the offences under S.121 (waging war against the Government of India). The conspiracy itself is a separate, serious offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 122 - Collecting arms, etc., with intention of waging war against the Government of India
content: This section punishes the collection of arms, ammunition, or otherwise preparing to wage war against the Government of India, with the intention of either waging such war or enabling others to do so.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 123 - Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
content: This section punishes anyone who, knowing a design to wage war exists, intentionally conceals it or provides any information or equipment that might help conceal the design or facilitate its accomplishment.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 124 - Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power
content: This section punishes assaulting or wrongfully restraining the President of India, a Governor of a state, or any minister, with the intent to induce or compel them to exercise or refrain from exercising their lawful powers.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

title: Section 124A - Sedition
content: This section defines and punishes the offence of Sedition. It involves bringing or attempting to bring into hatred or contempt, or exciting or attempting to excite disaffection towards, the Government established by law in India. This does not include strong criticism without incitement to violence or public disorder.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life (with fine), or imprisonment up to 3 years (with fine), or fine

title: Section 125 - Waging war against any Asiatic Power in alliance with the Government of India
content: This section punishes waging war against the government of any Asian power that is in alliance or at peace with the Government of India. It protects international relations and peace.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life (with fine), or imprisonment up to 7 years (with fine), or fine

title: Section 126 - Committing depredation on territories of Power at peace with the Government of India
content: This section punishes committing depredation (plundering, raiding) on the territories of any power at peace with the Government of India. It is aimed at preventing unauthorized cross-border military actions.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine (and forfeiture of property used)

title: Section 127 - Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 125 and 126
content: This section punishes receiving property that has been acquired through waging war or depredation as described in S.125 and S.126. It targets those who benefit from such illicit activities.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine (and forfeiture of such property)

title: Section 128 - Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of state or war to escape
content: This section punishes a public servant who is charged with guarding any prisoner of state or of war and who voluntarily allows that prisoner to escape.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 129 - Public servant negligently suffering prisoner of state or war to escape
content: This section punishes a public servant who, due to negligence or neglect of duty, allows a prisoner of state or of war to escape.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

title: Section 130 - Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner
content: This section punishes any person (not just a public servant) who aids the escape of, rescues, or harbours a prisoner of state or of war, knowing them to be such a prisoner.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 131 - Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor or airman from his duty
content: This section punishes abetting the mutiny of any member of the Army, Navy, or Air Force, or attempting to seduce them from their allegiance or duty.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 132 - Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof
content: If mutiny is actually committed as a consequence of the abetment under S.131, the abettor is punished with death or life imprisonment, or imprisonment for up to 10 years with a fine.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

title: Section 133 - Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office
content: This section punishes abetting an assault by a member of the armed forces on their superior officer while that officer is executing their duties.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine

title: Section 134 - Abetment of such assault, if the assault is committed
content: If the assault abetted under S.133 is actually committed, the punishment for the abettor is increased.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine

title: Section 135 - Harbouring deserter
content: This section punishes any person who knowingly harbours a deserter from the Army, Navy, or Air Force. It requires knowledge that the person is a deserter.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 136 - Harbouring deserter on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
content: This section holds the master of a merchant vessel liable if a deserter is harboured on board due to the master's negligence.. Punishment: Fine

title: Section 137 - Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
content: This section is similar to S.136 but deals with the act of concealment itself due to the master's negligence.. Punishment: Fine

title: Section 138 - Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman
content: This section punishes the abetment of any act of insubordination (willful defiance of authority) by a member of the armed forces, if the act is committed in consequence of the abetment.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 139 - Persons subject to certain Acts
content: [Repealed] This section has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 140 - Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman
content: This section punishes a person who is not a soldier, sailor, or airman for wearing the uniform or carrying a token used by such forces with the intention that it may be believed that they are such a member. This is aimed at preventing impersonation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 141 - Unlawful assembly
content: This section defines an 'unlawful assembly'. An assembly of five or more persons becomes unlawful if their common object is one of the following: 1) To overawe by criminal force the government or any official; 2) To resist the execution of any law; 3) To commit mischief, trespass or other offence; 4) To use criminal force to obtain possession of property or to enforce a right; 5) To use criminal force to compel a person to do what they are not legally bound to do.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of other offences)

title: Section 142 - Being member of unlawful assembly
content: This section states that whoever, being aware of facts which render any assembly an unlawful assembly, intentionally joins that assembly or continues in it, is a member of an unlawful assembly.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.143

title: Section 143 - Punishment for unlawful assembly
content: This section provides the punishment for simply being a member of an unlawful assembly.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 144 - Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment if a member of an unlawful assembly is armed with any deadly weapon or with anything which used as a weapon of offence is likely to cause death.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 145 - Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly, knowing it has been commanded to disperse
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment if a person joins or continues in an unlawful assembly after it has been lawfully commanded to disperse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 146 - Rioting
content: This section defines the offence of 'Rioting'. Whenever force or violence is used by an unlawful assembly, or by any member thereof, in prosecution of the common object of that assembly, every member of that assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.147

title: Section 147 - Punishment for rioting
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of rioting.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 148 - Rioting, armed with deadly weapon
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment for rioting if the rioter is armed with a deadly weapon.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 149 - Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
content: This is a crucial section on vicarious liability. If an offence is committed by any member of an unlawful assembly in prosecution of the common object of that assembly, every other member of the assembly is also guilty of that offence.. Punishment: Punishment for the offence committed by any member

title: Section 150 - Hiring, engaging or employing persons to take part in an unlawful assembly
content: This section punishes a person who hires, engages, or employs persons to be part of an unlawful assembly. The person hiring is liable for any offence committed by the hired persons in prosecution of the common object.. Punishment: Punishment for the offence committed by the hired assembly

title: Section 151 - Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
content: This section punishes knowingly being part of an assembly of five or more people likely to cause a disturbance of public peace, which has been lawfully commanded to disperse. Unlike S.145, the assembly here need not be initially 'unlawful' under S.141; it targets any disruptive gathering that disobeys dispersal orders.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 152 - Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
content: This section punishes assaulting or obstructing any public servant (or any person aiding them) in the execution of their duty of suppressing a riot or unlawful assembly. It protects authorities trying to restore order.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 153 - Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot—if rioting be committed—if not committed
content: This section punishes maliciously or wantonly doing anything with the intention of provoking a riot, even if the riot does not actually occur. If a riot is committed as a consequence, the punishment is higher.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both (Up to 6 years if riot occurs)

title: Section 153A - Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony
content: This section punishes acts that promote enmity, hatred, or ill-will between different religious, racial, language, or regional groups. It also punishes acts that are prejudicial to maintaining national harmony and integrity.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (Up to 5 years if offence committed in place of worship)

title: Section 153B - Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national-integration
content: This section punishes making imputations or assertions that any class of citizens cannot bear true faith to the Constitution of India or should be denied rights thereof, based on religion, race, language, etc., with intent to prejudice national integration.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 154 - Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held
content: This section holds the owner or occupier of any land liable if an unlawful assembly is held there and they, knowing it is happening, do not inform the authorities or use their lawful authority to disperse it.. Punishment: Fine up to Rs. 1000

title: Section 155 - Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed
content: This section holds a person liable for the actions of a riotous assembly if the riot was committed for their benefit, and they (or their agent) did not use all reasonable means to prevent it.. Punishment: Fine

title: Section 156 - Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit riot is committed
content: This section holds the agent of a person (mentioned in S.155) liable if the riot was committed for the benefit of their principal and the agent did not use reasonable means to prevent it.. Punishment: Fine

title: Section 157 - Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly
content: This section punishes harbouring, concealing, or receiving any person who has been hired to be part of an unlawful assembly, knowing that they have been so hired.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 158 - Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot
content: This section punishes the person who is themselves hired, engaged, or employed to be part of an unlawful assembly or to riot. It targets the hired participants.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 159 - Affray
content: This section defines the offence of 'Affray'. It is the fighting of two or more persons in a public place to the disturbance of the public peace. Unlike riot, it involves only a few people and does not require a common object.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.160

title: Section 160 - Punishment for committing affray
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of affray.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 100, or both

title: Section 161 - Public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration in respect of an official act
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the more comprehensive Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 162 - Taking gratification, in order, by corrupt or illegal means, to influence public servant
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 163 - Taking gratification, for exercise of personal influence with public servant
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 164 - Punishment for abetment by public servant of offences defined in section 162 or 163
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 165 - Public servant obtaining valuable thing, without consideration, from person concerned in proceeding or business transacted by such public servant
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 165A - Punishment for abetment of offences defined in section 161 or section 165
content: [Repealed] This section was replaced by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1987.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 166 - Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person
content: This section punishes a public servant who knowingly disobeys any direction of the law with the intention of causing injury or wrong to any person.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 166A - Public servant disobeying direction under law
content: This section specifically punishes a public servant for disobeying a legal direction to conduct an investigation or for disobeying any other legal direction. It was added to strengthen accountability.. Punishment: Imprisonment from 6 months to 2 years, and fine

title: Section 166B - Punishment for non-treatment of victim
content: This section punishes a hospital or medical practitioner (public or private) for refusing to provide immediate medical treatment to a victim of an accident or a crime, which is required under law.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 167 - Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury
content: This section punishes a public servant who prepares or frames an incorrect document (e.g., a report, certificate, record) with the intent to cause injury or loss to the public or to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 168 - Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
content: This section punishes a public servant for unlawfully engaging in any trade or business. It is aimed at preventing conflicts of interest.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 169 - Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
content: This section punishes a public servant for unlawfully buying or bidding for any property which they are legally duty-bound to sell in their official capacity.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both (and confiscation of property)

title: Section 170 - Personating a public servant
content: This section punishes a person who falsely represents themselves to be a public servant with the intention of cheating or harming others.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 171 - Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
content: This section punishes a person for wearing any dress or carrying any token resembling that used by a public servant, with a fraudulent intention.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 200, or both

title: Section 171A - Definition of candidate – electoral right
content: This section defines key terms for electoral offences: 'candidate' means a person who has been nominated as a candidate at an election, and 'electoral right' means the right of a person to vote or to stand for election.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 171B - Bribery
content: This section defines the offence of 'Bribery'. It involves giving, offering, or attempting to give a gratification to someone to induce them to exercise their electoral right in a specific way. It also covers accepting such gratification.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.171E

title: Section 171C - Undue influence at elections
content: This section defines 'Undue Influence' at elections. It involves any interference or attempt to interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right, including threats, injury, or inducements.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.171F

title: Section 171D - Personation at elections
content: This section defines 'Personation' at elections. It involves applying for a voting paper or voting in the name of someone else, whether that person is living, dead, or fictitious.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.171F

title: Section 171E - Punishment for bribery
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of bribery, as defined in S.171B.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both (If bribery by a candidate, fine may be unlimited)

title: Section 171F - Punishment for undue influence or personation at an election
content: This section provides the punishment for the offences of undue influence (S.171C) and personation (S.171D) at elections.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 171G - False statement in connection with an election
content: This section punishes making or publishing a false statement about the personal character or conduct of a candidate, or about their candidature, with the intention of affecting the outcome of an election.. Punishment: Fine

title: Section 171H - Illegal payments in connection with elections
content: This section punishes incurring or authorizing election expenses that are not authorized by law, or for purposes not permitted by law.. Punishment: Fine up to Rs. 500

title: Section 171I - Failure to keep election accounts
content: This section punishes a candidate (or their election agent) for failing to maintain and file a true and accurate account of their election expenses as required by law.. Punishment: Fine up to Rs. 500

title: Section 172 - Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
content: This section punishes absconding or concealing oneself to avoid being served a summons, notice, or order proceeding from a public servant.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 173 - Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof
content: This section punishes intentionally preventing the service of any summons, notice, or order, or preventing its lawful affixation or publication.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 174 - Not obeying a legal order to attend at a certain place in person or by agent, or departing without authority
content: This section punishes intentionally omitting to appear at a place when legally bound to appear there (in person or through an agent), or departing from that place without authority.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both (Higher punishment if to avoid giving evidence/information)

title: Section 175 - Intentionally omitting to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it
content: This section punishes a person who is legally bound to produce a document to a public servant but intentionally omits to do so.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both (Higher punishment if document required for preventing harm)

title: Section 176 - Intentionally omitting to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it
content: This section punishes a person legally bound to give any notice or information to a public servant who intentionally omits to do so.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both (Higher punishment if information required for preventing harm)

title: Section 177 - Furnishing false information
content: This section punishes a person who is legally bound to provide information to a public servant and instead provides information they know or believe to be false.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both (Higher punishment if related to offence against body/property)

title: Section 178 - Refusing oath when duly required by public servant to make it
content: This section punishes refusing to bind oneself by an oath or affirmation when legally required to do so by a public servant.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 179 - Refusing to answer public servant authorized to question
content: This section punishes refusing to answer any question demanded by a public servant who is authorized to ask that question.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 180 - Refusing to sign statement
content: This section punishes refusing to sign any statement made to a public servant when legally required to do so.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 181 - False statement on oath to public servant or person authorized to administer an oath
content: This section punishes making a false statement upon any subject when legally bound by an oath or affirmation to state the truth. This is the core offence of giving false evidence.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 182 - False information, with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
content: This section punishes giving false information to a public servant, intending to cause that public servant to use their lawful power to injure or annoy another person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 183 - Resistance to the taking of property by the lawful authority of a public servant
content: This section punishes offering resistance to the lawful seizure or attachment of any property by a public servant.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 184 - Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of public servant
content: This section punishes intentionally obstructing any sale of property being carried out by the lawful authority of a public servant.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 185 - Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant
content: This section punishes a person who is not legally entitled to do so from making a bid for or purchasing property offered for sale by the authority of a public servant.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 186 - Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
content: This section punishes voluntarily obstructing any public servant in the discharge of their public functions.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 187 - Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give assistance
content: This section punishes intentionally omitting to assist a public servant who is legally demanding aid in the execution of their duty, when one is bound by law to render such assistance.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 200, or both

title: Section 188 - Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
content: This section punishes disobedience to any order lawfully made by a public servant, if such disobedience causes obstruction, annoyance, injury, or risk to others. This is a very commonly used section.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 200, or both (If danger to human life/health/safety, up to 6 months)

title: Section 189 - Threat of injury to public servant
content: This section punishes holding out a threat of injury to a public servant to deter them from doing their official duty, or to make them do something they are not legally bound to do.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 190 - Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
content: This section punishes threatening someone to prevent them from seeking the protection of a public servant against an injury, or to compel them to withdraw such an application.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 191 - Giving false evidence
content: This section defines the offence of 'giving false evidence'. A person is said to give false evidence if they are legally bound by an oath or law to state the truth and make a false statement.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.193

title: Section 192 - Fabricating false evidence
content: This section defines 'fabricating false evidence'. It involves creating a situation or making a false entry in a record to cause a public servant to form an erroneous opinion on a point material to the outcome of a proceeding.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.193

title: Section 193 - Punishment for false evidence
content: This section provides the punishment for giving false evidence (perjury) and fabricating false evidence. If committed in a judicial proceeding, the punishment is higher.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine (if judicial proceeding); up to 3 years and fine (in other cases)

title: Section 194 - Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
content: This section punishes giving or fabricating false evidence with the intention of causing an innocent person to be convicted of a capital offence (punishable with death).. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 195 - Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life
content: This section punishes giving or fabricating false evidence with the intention of causing an innocent person to be convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 7 years or more.. Punishment: Punishment as for the offence they tried to impute (e.g., up to life imprisonment)

title: Section 195A - Threatening any person to give false evidence
content: This section punishes threatening another person to induce them to give false evidence or to fabricate false evidence, or to cause them to not produce evidence in a proceeding.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 196 - Using evidence known to be false
content: This section punishes corruptly using or attempting to use as true or genuine any evidence which one knows to be false or fabricated.. Punishment: Punishment as for giving false evidence (S.193)

title: Section 197 - Issuing or signing false certificate
content: This section punishes issuing or signing a certificate required by law to be given or signed, knowing that it is false in a material point.. Punishment: Punishment as for giving false evidence (S.193)

title: Section 198 - Using as true a certificate known to be false
content: This section punishes using as true a certificate known to be false.. Punishment: Punishment as for giving false evidence (S.193)

title: Section 199 - False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
content: This section punishes making a false statement in any declaration which is by law receivable as evidence, knowing it to be false.. Punishment: Punishment as for giving false evidence (S.193)

title: Section 200 - Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false
content: This section punishes using as true a declaration that is receivable as evidence, knowing it to be false.. Punishment: Punishment as for giving false evidence (S.193)

title: Section 201 - Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
content: This section punishes anyone who, knowing or having reason to believe an offence has been committed, causes evidence to disappear or gives false information to screen the offender from legal punishment. If the offence is capital (e.g., murder), punishment is severe.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine (if offence is capital); up to 3 years, and fine (if punishable with life imprisonment); up to 1/4th of the max imprisonment for that offence, and fine (for other offences)

title: Section 202 - Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform
content: This section punishes a person who is legally bound to inform a public servant about an offence but intentionally omits to do so, despite knowing or having reason to believe the offence has been committed.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both (if offence is capital); up to 3 years, or fine, or both (if punishable with life imprisonment); up to 1/4th of the max imprisonment for that offence, or fine, or both (for other offences)

title: Section 203 - Giving false information respecting an offence committed
content: This section punishes a person who, knowing or believing an offence has been committed, provides false information about that offence to a public servant. It differs from S.201 as it doesn't require an intent to screen the offender.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both (if offence is capital); up to 1/4th of the max imprisonment for that offence, or fine, or both (for other offences)

title: Section 204 - Destruction of document to prevent its production as evidence
content: This section punishes secretly destroying, defaces, or removes any document or electronic record with the intention of preventing it from being produced as evidence in a legal proceeding, or by a public servant.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 205 - False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
content: This section punishes falsely pretending to be another person in any suit or legal proceeding, with intent to gain a benefit for oneself or cause injury to that other person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 206 - Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
content: This section punishes fraudulently removing, concealing, transferring, or delivering any property to prevent it from being taken as forfeiture to the government or under a court decree.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 207 - Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
content: This section punishes fraudulently accepting, claiming, or asserting a right to any property, knowing that such a claim is false, to prevent that property from being taken as forfeiture or under a court decree.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 208 - Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
content: This section punishes a person who fraudulently causes or suffers a decree to be passed against them for a sum of money that is not due, or for a larger sum than is due, with intent to injure another person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 209 - Dishonestly making false claim in Court
content: This section punishes fraudulently or dishonestly making a false claim in a Court of Justice, or instituting a false suit, with intent to injure or annoy another person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine

title: Section 210 - Fraudulently obtaining decree for false claim
content: This section punishes a person who fraudulently obtains a decree or order for any false claim they have made in a Court of Justice.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine

title: Section 211 - False charge of offence made with intent to injure
content: This section punishes making a false charge of an offence to a public servant, knowing the charge to be false, and with the intent to cause injury to another person. This is a serious offence against justice.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both (If offence is capital or punishable with 7+ years, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine)

title: Section 212 - Harbouring offender
content: This section punishes harbouring or concealing a person who has committed an offence, knowing or having reason to believe that the person has committed that offence, with the intention of screening them from legal punishment.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (If offence is capital, imprisonment up to 5 years and fine; if life imprisonment, imprisonment up to 3 years and fine)

title: Section 213 - Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment
content: This section punishes taking a gift or valuable consideration to screen an offender from legal punishment, or to not prosecute them, or to help them recover any property acquired through the offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (If offence is capital, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine; if life imprisonment, imprisonment up to 3 years and fine)

title: Section 214 - Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender
content: This section is the mirror of S.213. It punishes offering a gift or restoration of property to another person as a consideration for screening an offender.. Punishment: Punishment of the same nature and rigour as for the offence under S.213

title: Section 215 - Taking gift to help to recover movable property of which a person has been deprived by an offence, without causing apprehension of offender
content: This section punishes taking a gift to help recover stolen property, but without the intention of screening the offender from punishment. The focus is on recovery, not protecting the criminal.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 216 - Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody or whose apprehension has been ordered
content: This section punishes harbouring or concealing an offender who has either escaped from custody or for whom a warrant of apprehension has been issued, knowing them to be such an escaped offender.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (If offence is capital or punishable with life imprisonment, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine)

title: Section 216A - Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for habitually harbouring or associating with robbers or dacoits (members of a gang for robbery), knowing them to be such.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 216B - Definition of harbour
content: [Repealed by the Indian Penal Code (Amendment) Act, 1942]. Punishment: nan

title: Section 217 - Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
content: This section punishes a public servant who knowingly disobeys any direction of the law as a public servant, with the intention of saving any person from legal punishment or any property from forfeiture.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 218 - Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
content: This section punishes a public servant who frames an incorrect record or writing with the intention of saving any person from legal punishment or any property from forfeiture.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 219 - Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law
content: This section punishes a public servant (in a judicial capacity) who corruptly or maliciously makes any report, order, or decision which they know is contrary to law.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 220 - Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
content: This section punishes a person in authority who corruptly or maliciously commits any person for trial or confines them, knowing that they are acting contrary to law in doing so.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 221 - Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
content: This section punishes a public servant who is legally bound to apprehend or keep in confinement any person, but intentionally omits to do so, or aids in their escape or attempted escape..
