Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, with or without fine (if offence is capital or punishable with life imprisonment); up to 3 years, with or without fine (if punishable with 1+ year imprisonment); up to 2 years, with or without fine (for other offences)

title: Section 222 - Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend person under sentence or lawfully committed
content: This section is a specific version of S.221. It punishes a public servant for intentionally allowing a person who is under a court sentence or lawfully committed to custody to escape.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 14 years, with or without fine (if sentence was death/life imprisonment); up to 7 years, with or without fine (if sentence was for 10+ years); up to 3 years, with or without fine (for other sentences)

title: Section 223 - Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant
content: This section punishes a public servant who, due to negligence or neglect of duty, allows a person in their confinement or custody to escape.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 224 - Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
content: This section punishes a person who intentionally offers resistance or illegal obstruction to their own lawful apprehension for an offence they have committed or attempted to commit.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 225 - Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
content: This section punishes a person who intentionally offers resistance or illegal obstruction to the lawful apprehension of any other person for an offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both (If offence is capital or punishable with life imprisonment, imprisonment up to 3 years and fine; if punishable with 10+ years, imprisonment up to 2 years and fine)

title: Section 225A - Omission to apprehend, or sufferance of escape, on part of public servant, in cases not otherwise provided for
content: This section is a residual clause. It punishes a public servant for omitting to apprehend or allowing the escape of a person in any case not already covered by S.221, 222, or 223.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 225B - Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension, or escape or rescue in cases not otherwise provided for
content: This section is a residual clause for resistance and escape. It punishes acts of resistance, obstruction, escape, or rescue in cases not specifically provided for in other sections.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 226 - Unlawful return from transportation
content: [Repealed] This section, which dealt with punishment for unlawfully returning from transportation, has been omitted.. Punishment: nan

title: Section 227 - Violation of condition of remission of punishment
content: This section punishes a person for violating any condition on which a punishment was remitted (forgiven or reduced). It applies to any punishment, not just transportation.. Punishment: Punishment of the original offence, or if part of punishment was already undergone, imprisonment for the remaining part

title: Section 228 - Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
content: This section punishes intentionally offering any insult or causing any interruption to any public servant (e.g., a judge) while they are sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 228A - Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences etc.
content: This section prohibits publishing the name or any matter which may reveal the identity of a victim of rape, sexual assault, or related offences. It protects the privacy and dignity of the victim.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine

title: Section 229 - Personation of a juror or assessor
content: This section punishes a person who falsely pretends to be a juror or an assessor (a person appointed to advise a judge) and acts as such, or serves on a jury knowing they are not entitled to serve.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 229A - Failure by person released on bail or bond to appear in Court
content: This section specifically punishes a person who, after being released on bail or on a bond, fails to appear before the Court as required by the conditions of their release.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both (If offence is non-bailable, punishment for contempt of court)

title: Section 230 - Coin – Government of India
content: This section defines 'coin' as metal used as money, stamped and issued by the authority of the Government of India or a foreign government to be used as money.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 231 - Counterfeiting coin
content: This section defines and punishes the act of counterfeiting, or performing any part of the process of counterfeiting, coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 232 - Counterfeiting Indian coin
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for counterfeiting Indian coin (as opposed to foreign coin).. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 233 - Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
content: This section punishes making, mending, buying, selling, or disposing of any tool or instrument for the purpose of being used in counterfeiting coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine (For Indian coin, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine)

title: Section 234 - Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for making or selling instruments specifically for counterfeiting Indian coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 235 - Possession of instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin
content: This section punishes being in possession of any tool or material intended to be used for counterfeiting coin, knowing it to be for such purpose.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine (For Indian coin, imprisonment up to 10 years and fine)

title: Section 236 - Abetting in India the counterfeiting out of India of coin
content: This section punishes abetting, from within India, the counterfeiting of coin outside of India.. Punishment: Punishment as for counterfeiting such coin itself

title: Section 237 - Import or export of counterfeit coin
content: This section punishes importing or exporting counterfeit coin, knowing it to be counterfeit.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 238 - Import or export of counterfeits of the Indian coin
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for importing or exporting counterfeit Indian coin, knowing it to be counterfeit.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 239 - Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
content: This section punishes delivering to another person any coin which you know to be counterfeit, with the intention that it be passed off as genuine.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine

title: Section 240 - Delivery of Indian coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for delivering counterfeit Indian coin, knowing it to be counterfeit.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 241 - Delivery of coin as genuine, which when first possessed the deliverer did not know to be counterfeit
content: This section punishes a person who delivers a counterfeit coin as genuine, but who only discovered it was counterfeit after receiving it and before delivering it to someone else.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or up to 10 times the value of the coin

title: Section 242 - Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
content: This section punishes being in possession of a counterfeit coin, knowing it to be counterfeit at the time you acquired it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 243 - Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for possessing counterfeit Indian coin, knowing it to be counterfeit when you acquired it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 244 - Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition from that fixed by law
content: This section punishes a worker in a government mint who deliberately causes coins to be made of a weight or composition different from that established by law.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 245 - Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint
content: This section punishes unlawfully taking out of a government mint any tool or instrument used for the process of coining.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 246 - Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
content: This section punishes fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing the weight or altering the composition of any coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 247 - Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing the weight or altering the composition of Indian coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 248 - Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
content: This section punishes altering the appearance of a coin with the intention that it shall pass as a coin of a different description (e.g., of higher value).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 249 - Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for altering the appearance of Indian coin with the intent to pass it as a different Indian coin.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 250 - Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is altered
content: This section punishes delivering to another person any coin which you know has been altered (e.g., in weight, composition, or appearance), with the intention that it be used as genuine.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine

title: Section 251 - Delivery of Indian coin, possessed with knowledge that it is altered
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for delivering altered Indian coin (as opposed to foreign coin), knowing it to be altered, with the intent that it be used as genuine.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 252 - Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
content: This section is a repeat/verification. It punishes being in possession of any counterfeit coin, knowing it to be counterfeit at the time of acquisition. (Note: This is identical to S.242. It may be an error or specific emphasis in certain editions).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 253 - Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for possessing counterfeit Indian coin, knowing it to be counterfeit when acquired. (Note: This is identical to S.243).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 254 - Delivery of coin as genuine, which when first possessed the deliverer did not know to be counterfeit
content: This section punishes a person who, after receiving a coin in good faith, discovers it is counterfeit but still delivers it to another person as if it were genuine.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or up to ten times the value of the coin

title: Section 255 - Counterfeiting Government stamp
content: This section defines and punishes the act of counterfeiting, or performing any part of the process of counterfeiting, any stamp issued by the Government for revenue purposes.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 256 - Having possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Government stamp
content: This section punishes being in possession of any tool or material intended for counterfeiting a government stamp, knowing it is to be used for that purpose.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 257 - Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp
content: This section punishes making, repairing, buying, selling, or disposing of any instrument for the purpose of being used in counterfeiting a government stamp.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 258 - Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
content: This section punishes selling, or offering for sale, any counterfeit government stamp, knowing it to be counterfeit.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 259 - Having possession of counterfeit Government stamp
content: This section punishes being in possession of any counterfeit government stamp, knowing it to be counterfeit. It must be with intent to use or dispose of it as genuine.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 260 - Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
content: This section punishes using as genuine any government stamp which one knows to be counterfeit.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 261 - Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss to Government
content: This section punishes fraudulently or dishonestly effacing any writing from a substance bearing a government stamp, or removing a used stamp from a document, with the intention of causing financial loss to the government by reusing the stamp.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 262 - Using Government stamp known to have been before used
content: This section punishes using as genuine any government stamp which one knows has already been used before.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 263 - Erasure of mark denoting that stamp has been used
content: This section punishes fraudulently erasing or removing any mark that indicates a government stamp has been used, with the intent to reuse it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 263A - Prohibition of fictitious stamps
content: This section punishes making, selling, or possessing any fictitious stamp, which is a stamp that resembles a government stamp but is not actually issued by the government for revenue. It also covers using such a stamp.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 264 - Fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing
content: This section punishes fraudulently using any false instrument for weighing (like a rigged scale) with the intent to defraud.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 265 - Fraudulent use of false weight or measure
content: This section punishes fraudulently using any false weight or measure (like a light kilogram weight) with the intent to defraud.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 266 - Being in possession of false weight or measure
content: This section punishes being in possession of any false weight or measure, knowing it to be false, with the intention that it be used to defraud.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 267 - Making or selling false weight or measure
content: This section punishes making, selling, or disposing of any false weight or measure, knowing that it is false and that it is likely to be used to defraud.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 268 - Public nuisance
content: This section defines a 'public nuisance'. It is an act or illegal omission which causes common injury, danger, or annoyance to the public or to people dwelling in the vicinity. It must affect the public, not just individuals.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element of other offences)

title: Section 269 - Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
content: This section punishes a negligent act which is likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 270 - Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
content: This section punishes a malignant (intentional or reckless) act which is likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life. It implies a greater degree of culpability than S.269.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 271 - Disobedience to quarantine rule
content: This section punishes voluntary disobedience to any rule made and promulgated by the government for placing any person or ship under quarantine (isolation to prevent spread of disease).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 272 - Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
content: This section punishes adulterating any article of food or drink so that it becomes noxious (harmful) as food or drink, with the intention of selling it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 273 - Sale of noxious food or drink
content: This section punishes selling, offering, or exposing for sale any article of food or drink which one knows to be noxious (harmful).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 274 - Adulteration of drugs
content: This section punishes adulterating any drug or medical preparation so that it becomes less effective, different in effect, or noxious, with the intention of selling it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 275 - Sale of adulterated drugs
content: This section punishes selling, offering, or exposing for sale any drug which one knows to have been adulterated.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 276 - Sale of drug as a different drug or preparation
content: This section punishes selling, or offering for sale, any drug or medical preparation as a different drug or preparation, knowing it is not that drug.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 277 - Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
content: This section punishes voluntarily corrupting or fouling the water of a public spring or reservoir so as to make it less fit for the purpose it is ordinarily used for.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 278 - Making atmosphere noxious to health
content: This section punishes voluntarily vitiating the atmosphere in any place to make it noxious to the health of persons in the vicinity or dwelling nearby.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to Rs. 500

title: Section 279 - Rash driving or riding on a public way
content: This section punishes driving any vehicle or riding on any public way in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life or likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 280 - Rash navigation of vessel
content: This section punishes navigating any vessel in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life or likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 281 - Exhibition of false light, mark or buoy
content: This section punishes exhibiting any false light, mark, or buoy with the intention of misleading navigators.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 282 - Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel
content: This section punishes knowingly or negligently conveying a person by water in a vessel that is unsafe, overloaded, or otherwise unfit for the journey, when that conveyance is for hire.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 283 - Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation
content: This section punishes causing danger, obstruction, or injury to any person in any public way or line of navigation by doing any act or leaving any thing in that space.. Punishment: Fine up to Rs. 200

title: Section 284 - Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
content: This section punishes a negligent act with any poisonous substance which is likely to cause hurt or injury to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 285 - Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
content: This section punishes a negligent act with fire or any combustible matter which is likely to cause hurt or injury to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 286 - Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
content: This section punishes a negligent act with any explosive substance which is likely to cause hurt or injury to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 287 - Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
content: This section punishes a negligent act with any machinery, where that act is likely to cause hurt or injury to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 288 - Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
content: This section punishes a negligent act in pulling down or repairing any building, which is likely to endanger human life.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 289 - Negligent conduct with respect to animal
content: This section punishes a negligent act with respect to any animal in one's possession, which is likely to cause hurt or injury to any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 290 - Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
content: This section is a general provision that punishes the commission of a public nuisance for which no specific punishment is provided elsewhere in the Code.. Punishment: Fine up to Rs. 200

title: Section 291 - Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment if a person continues a public nuisance after receiving a legal injunction (order) to discontinue it.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 292 - Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
content: This section punishes the sale, hire, distribution, public exhibition, or circulation of any obscene book, pamphlet, paper, drawing, painting, representation, or any other obscene object.. Punishment: First conviction: up to 2 years imprisonment and fine up to Rs. 2000. Subsequent conviction: up to 5 years imprisonment and fine up to Rs. 5000.

title: Section 293 - Sale, etc., of obscene objects to young person
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for selling, hiring, distributing, exhibiting, or circulating any obscene object to any person under the age of twenty years.. Punishment: First conviction: up to 3 years imprisonment and fine up to Rs. 2000. Subsequent conviction: up to 7 years imprisonment and fine up to Rs. 5000.

title: Section 294 - Obscene acts and songs
content: This section punishes doing any obscene act in any public place, or singing, reciting, or uttering any obscene song, ballad, or words in or near any public place, to the annoyance of others.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 294A - Keeping lottery office
content: This section punishes keeping any office or place for the purpose of drawing any lottery, unless it is a state lottery or authorized by the state government. It does not include betting or gambling.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 295 - Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class
content: This section punishes destroying, damaging, or defiling any place of worship or any object held sacred by any class of persons, with the deliberate intention of thereby insulting the religion of that class.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 295A - Deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs
content: This section punishes deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage the religious feelings of any class of citizens by insulting its religion or religious beliefs. This includes spoken/written words, signs, visible representations.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 296 - Disturbing religious assembly
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing disturbance to any assembly lawfully engaged in religious worship or religious ceremonies.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 297 - Trespassing on burial places, etc.
content: This section punishes trespassing in any place of worship or any place of sepulchre (burial/cremation ground), or any place set apart for funeral rites, with the intent to wound the feelings of any person or to insult the religion of any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 298 - Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
content: This section punishes uttering any word or making any sound in the hearing of a person, or making any gesture or placing any object in the sight of a person, with the deliberate intent to wound their religious feelings.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 299 - Culpable homicide
content: This section defines 'culpable homicide'. It is causing death by doing an act: 1) with the intention of causing death, or 2) with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or 3) with the knowledge that the act is likely to cause death.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Defines the offence for S.304)

title: Section 300 - Murder
content: This section defines when culpable homicide amounts to 'murder'. It outlines specific circumstances where the act is done with the clear intention of causing death, or with such intention and knowledge that it falls into the category of the most serious homicide.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Defines the offence for S.302)

title: Section 301 - Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
content: This section, often called the 'Doctrine of Transfer of Malice', states that if a person causes death by doing an act with the intention of killing a specific person, but instead kills another person, the offence is still culpable homicide. The intent is transferred from the intended victim to the actual victim.. Punishment: Punishment as for the offence if the intended person had been killed (e.g., Murder under S.302)

title: Section 302 - Punishment for murder
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of murder, as defined in S.300.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life, and fine

title: Section 303 - Punishment for murder by life-convict
content: This section provided mandatory death sentence for a person already serving a life sentence who commits murder. It was declared unconstitutional by the Supreme Court of India in 1983 (Mithu vs. State of Punjab).. Punishment: [Unconstitutional]

title: Section 304 - Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
content: This section provides the punishment for culpable homicide that does not fall under the definition of murder. It is divided into two parts: Part 1 for acts done with the intention of causing death or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death; Part 2 for acts done with the knowledge that they are likely to cause death, but without intention.. Punishment: Part 1: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine. Part 2: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or fine, or both.

title: Section 304A - Causing death by negligence
content: This section punishes causing the death of any person by a rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide (which requires higher intention/knowledge).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 304B - Dowry death
content: This section defines and punishes 'dowry death'. Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury, or occurs under abnormal circumstances, within 7 years of marriage, and it is shown that she was soon before her death subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or his relative for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry.. Punishment: Imprisonment of not less than 7 years which may extend to imprisonment for life

title: Section 305 - Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
content: This section punishes abetting the suicide of a person under eighteen years of age, or any insane person, or delirious person, or an idiot, or any person in a state of intoxication.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 306 - Abetment of suicide
content: This section punishes abetting the commission of suicide of any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 307 - Attempt to murder
content: This section punishes the attempt to commit murder. If hurt is caused in the attempt, the punishment is more severe. If the act is done under the circumstances that would constitute murder if the person died, the attempt is punished.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine (If hurt is caused, imprisonment up to life, and fine)

title: Section 308 - Attempt to commit culpable homicide
content: This section punishes the attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder. It applies when an act is done with such intention or knowledge that it would constitute culpable homicide if the person died.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (If hurt is caused, imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both)

title: Section 309 - Attempt to commit suicide
content: This section punishes a person who attempts to commit suicide. The Supreme Court has decriminalized attempt to suicide, but the section remains in the statute. Mental Healthcare Act, 2017 assumes such a person has severe stress and provides for treatment, not punishment.. Punishment: [Decriminalized in practice]

title: Section 310 - Thug
content: This section defines a 'Thug' as a person who is either a habitually associated with others for committing robbery or child kidnapping by means of or accompanied with murder. This is a historical offence.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.311)

title: Section 311 - Punishment
content: This section provides the punishment for being a Thug.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, and fine

title: Section 312 - Causing miscarriage
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing a woman with child to miscarry. If the woman is quick with child (felt the child move), the punishment is higher. It does not apply if done in good faith to save the woman's life.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (If quick with child, imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine)

title: Section 313 - Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
content: This section punishes causing miscarriage without the consent of the woman, whether she is quick with child or not. This is a more serious offence than S.312.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 314 - Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
content: This section punishes an act done with intent to cause a miscarriage, if that act causes the death of the woman. It does not require intent to kill the woman.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine (If act done without consent, imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine)

title: Section 315 - Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth
content: This section punishes an act done before or during birth with the intention of preventing a child from being born alive, or causing it to die after its birth. It does not amount to murder if the child dies.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 316 - Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
content: This section punishes causing the death of a quick unborn child (a fetus that has moved) by an act which would amount to culpable homicide if it had caused the death of the mother.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 317 - Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years, by parent or person having care of it
content: This section punishes a parent or caregiver for exposing or leaving a child under twelve years of age with the intention of wholly abandoning it.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 318 - Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
content: This section punishes secretly disposing of the dead body of a child, whether the child died before, during, or after birth, with the intention of concealing its birth.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 319 - Hurt
content: This section defines 'Hurt' as causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person. This is the basic definition for all offences against the human body involving injury.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.323, etc.)

title: Section 320 - Grievous hurt
content: This section defines 'Grievous Hurt' by listing specific kinds of hurt, which are considered more serious. These include emasculation, permanent privation of sight/hearing/speech/limb/joint, permanent disfigurement, fracture, and hurt which endangers life or causes severe pain for 20 days.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.325, etc.)

title: Section 321 - Voluntarily causing hurt
content: This section defines the mental element for voluntarily causing hurt. It is doing an act with the intention of causing hurt, or with the knowledge that it is likely to cause hurt.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.323

title: Section 322 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
content: This section defines the mental element for voluntarily causing grievous hurt. It is doing an act with the intention of causing grievous hurt, or with the knowledge that it is likely to cause grievous hurt.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.325

title: Section 323 - Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of voluntarily causing hurt, as defined in S.319 and S.321.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 324 - Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for voluntarily causing hurt by any instrument for shooting/stabbing/cutting, or any instrument used as a weapon of offence, or by fire/ heated substance/ poison/ corrosive substance/ explosive, or by any animal.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 325 - Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of voluntarily causing grievous hurt, as defined in S.320 and S.322.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 326 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt by any instrument for shooting/stabbing/cutting, or any instrument used as a weapon of offence, or by fire/ heated substance/ poison/ corrosive substance/ explosive.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 326A - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid, etc.
content: This section provides specific and severe punishment for voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid on another person, or administering acid to them, with the intention of causing permanent damage, deformity, or disfigurement.. Punishment: Imprisonment of not less than 10 years which may extend to imprisonment for life, and fine (fine shall be just and reasonable to meet medical expenses)

title: Section 326B - Voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid
content: This section punishes voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid on another person with the intention of causing hurt or injury. It covers attempts even if no injury is caused.. Punishment: Imprisonment of not less than 5 years which may extend to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 327 - Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing hurt for the purpose of extorting any property or valuable security, or to constrain someone to do anything illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 328 - Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
content: This section punishes administering any poison or intoxicating/stupefying/unwholesome drug to any person with the intent to commit or facilitate the commission of an offence, or knowing it is likely to cause hurt.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 329 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting property or to constrain someone to do an illegal act. This is a more severe version of S.327.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 330 - Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing hurt to extort a confession or any information, or to compel the restoration of any property or valuable security.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 331 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort a confession or to compel the restoration of property. This is a more severe version of S.330.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 332 - Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing hurt to a public servant to deter them from their duty, or in consequence of anything done by that public servant in the lawful discharge of their duty.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 333 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt to a public servant to deter them from their duty. This is a more severe version of S.332.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 334 - Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
content: This section provides a lesser punishment for voluntarily causing hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if the offender did not intend to cause grievous hurt.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 335 - Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
content: This section provides a lesser punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 4 years, or fine up to Rs. 2000, or both

title: Section 336 - Act endangering life or personal safety of others
content: This section punishes doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 250, or both

title: Section 337 - Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
content: This section punishes causing hurt to any person by doing an act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or personal safety.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 338 - Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
content: This section punishes causing grievous hurt to any person by doing an act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or personal safety.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 339 - Wrongful restraint
content: This section defines 'Wrongful Restraint'. It is voluntarily obstructing a person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.341)

title: Section 340 - Wrongful confinement
content: This section defines 'Wrongful Confinement'. It is a form of wrongful restraint where a person is prevented from proceeding beyond certain circumscribed limits. It means keeping someone within limits they are not entitled to leave.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.342)

title: Section 341 - Punishment for wrongful restraint
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of wrongful restraint, as defined in S.339.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 342 - Punishment for wrongful confinement
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of wrongful confinement, as defined in S.340.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 343 - Wrongful confinement for three or more days
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for wrongful confinement that lasts for three days or more.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 344 - Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for wrongful confinement that lasts for ten days or more.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 345 - Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for wrongfully confining a person, knowing that a writ (like a Habeas Corpus) has been issued for their liberation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years in addition to the punishment under S.342

title: Section 346 - Wrongful confinement in secret
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for wrongful confinement that is done in a secret place.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years in addition to the punishment under S.342

title: Section 347 - Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
content: This section punishes wrongfully confining any person for the purpose of extorting property, or constraining them to do an illegal act or give information.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 348 - Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
content: This section punishes wrongfully confining any person for the purpose of extorting a confession, or compelling the restoration of any property.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

title: Section 349 - Force
content: This section defines 'Force'. A person uses force to another if they cause motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion to that other person, or to any substance, without their consent. This is the basic definition for assault, criminal force, etc.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.350)

title: Section 350 - Criminal force
content: This section defines 'Criminal Force' as the intentional use of force to any person, without their consent, with the intention of committing an offence, or to cause injury, fear, or annoyance to that person.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.352)

title: Section 351 - Assault
content: This section defines 'Assault'. It is the act of making any gesture or preparation by a person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such gesture or preparation will cause any person present to apprehend that criminal force is about to be used against them. No actual force is required; the threat or apprehension is enough.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.352)

title: Section 352 - Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
content: This section provides the general punishment for committing assault or using criminal force against any person, provided it is not done under grave and sudden provocation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to Rs. 500, or both

title: Section 353 - Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
content: This section punishes assault or use of criminal force against a public servant to deter them from discharging their duty, or because of anything done by them in the lawful discharge of their duty.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 354 - Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
content: This section punishes assault or use of criminal force against any woman with the intention to outrage her modesty or knowing it to be likely that it will outrage her modesty.. Punishment: Imprisonment from 1 to 5 years, and fine

title: Section 354A - Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment
content: This section defines and punishes 'Sexual Harassment'. It includes physical contact and advances, demand for sexual favours, making sexually coloured remarks, or showing pornography against a woman's will.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 354B - Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
content: This section punishes assaulting or using criminal force on any woman to compel her to be naked, or to disrobe her.. Punishment: Imprisonment from 3 to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 354C - Voyeurism
content: This section punishes watching or capturing the image of a woman engaging in a private act without her consent, where she has an expectation of privacy.. Punishment: 1st conviction: 1 to 3 years imprisonment and fine. Subsequent conviction: 3 to 7 years imprisonment and fine.

title: Section 354D - Stalking
content: This section defines and punishes 'Stalking'. It involves following a woman and contacting or attempting to contact her to foster personal interaction despite clear indication of disinterest, or monitoring her internet/electronic activity.. Punishment: 1st conviction: up to 3 years imprisonment and fine. Subsequent conviction: up to 5 years imprisonment and fine.

title: Section 355 - Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation
content: This section punishes assault or criminal force used with the intention of dishonouring a person, and not on grave and sudden provocation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 356 - Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
content: This section punishes assault or criminal force used in an attempt to commit theft of any property that is being carried by a person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 357 - Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
content: This section punishes assault or criminal force used in an attempt to wrongfully confine a person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to Rs. 1000, or both

title: Section 358 - Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
content: This section provides a lesser punishment for assault or criminal force that is committed on grave and sudden provocation.. Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to Rs. 200, or both

title: Section 359 - Kidnapping
content: This section defines the two types of kidnapping: 1) Kidnapping from India, and 2) Kidnapping from lawful guardianship.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.363)

title: Section 360 - Kidnapping from India
content: This section defines 'Kidnapping from India'. It means taking any person beyond the limits of India without the consent of that person, or of some person legally authorized to consent on their behalf.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.363)

title: Section 361 - Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
content: This section defines 'Kidnapping from lawful guardianship'. It means taking or enticing a minor (under sixteen if a male, under eighteen if a female) or any person of unsound mind, out of the keeping of the lawful guardian without the guardian's consent.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.363)

title: Section 362 - Abduction
content: This section defines 'Abduction'. It means forcibly compelling a person to go from any place, or deceitfully inducing a person to go from any place. Unlike kidnapping, the age of the person is irrelevant.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for other offences like S.365)

title: Section 363 - Punishment for kidnapping
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of kidnapping, as defined in S.360 and S.361.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 363A - Kidnapping or maiming a minor for purposes of begging
content: This section specifically punishes kidnapping a minor for the purpose of begging, or maiming a minor to be used for begging.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, and fine (for kidnapping); Imprisonment for life, and fine (for maiming)

title: Section 364 - Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
content: This section punishes kidnapping or abducting any person with the intention of murdering them or with the knowledge that they are likely to be murdered.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 364A - Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
content: This section punishes kidnapping or abducting any person and holding them to ransom or to extort any benefit, or that results in the death of the victim or them being put in danger of death.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life, and fine

title: Section 365 - Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
content: This section punishes kidnapping or abducting any person with the intention of secretly and wrongfully confining them.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 366 - Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
content: This section punishes kidnapping, abducting, or inducing a woman to force her into marriage against her will, or to force or seduce her to have illicit intercourse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 366A - Procuration of minor girl
content: This section punishes inducing a minor girl (under 18 years) to go from any place or to do any act with the intent that she may be, or knowing it to be likely that she will be, forced into illicit intercourse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 366B - Importation of girl from foreign country
content: This section punishes importing into India a girl under the age of twenty-one years with the intent that she will be forced into illicit intercourse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 367 - Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
content: This section punishes kidnapping or abducting any person with the intention of subjecting them to grievous hurt, slavery, or to the unnatural lust of any person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 368 - Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person
content: This section punishes a person who, knowing that another person has been kidnapped or abducted, wrongfully conceals or confines that person.. Punishment: Punishment same as for kidnapping or abducting under Ss. 363, 364, 364A, 365, 366, 367

title: Section 369 - Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person
content: This section punishes kidnapping or abducting a child under ten years of age with the intention of taking any property from the child's person.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 370 - Trafficking of person
content: This section defines and punishes 'Trafficking'. It involves recruiting, transporting, harboring, transferring, or receiving a person for exploitation by using force, fraud, or inducement. Exploitation includes prostitution, forced labor, slavery, and organ removal.. Punishment: Imprisonment from 7 to 10 years, and fine (more severe for multiple victims, minors, etc.)

title: Section 370A - Exploitation of a trafficked person
content: This section punishes a person for exploiting a trafficked person, knowing that such person has been trafficked.. Punishment: Punishment same as for trafficking under S.370

title: Section 371 - Habitual dealing in slaves
content: This section punishes habitually dealing in slaves, including importing, exporting, removing, buying, selling, or disposing of any person as a slave.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 372 - Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
content: This section punishes selling, letting to hire, or otherwise disposing of any person under the age of eighteen years for the purpose of prostitution or illicit intercourse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 373 - Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
content: This section punishes buying, hiring, or otherwise obtaining possession of any person under the age of eighteen years for the purpose of prostitution or illicit intercourse.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 374 - Unlawful compulsory labor
content: This section punishes unlawfully compelling any person to labor against their will.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 375 - Rape
content: This section defines the offence of 'Rape'. It is the non-consensual sexual intercourse with a woman under various circumstances: against her will, without her consent, with consent obtained under fear/coercion/fraud/misconception, or when she is under 18 years of age.. Punishment: Punishment as per S.376

title: Section 376 - Punishment for rape
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of rape. It includes enhanced punishment for certain circumstances like rape by police officer, on a pregnant woman, on a woman under 16, etc.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment of not less than 10 years, which may extend to life imprisonment, and fine (In some cases, minimum 20 years or life imprisonment)

title: Section 376A - Intercourse by a man with his wife during separation
content: This section punishes a man for having sexual intercourse with his own wife, who is living separately from him under a decree of separation or any custom or usage, without her consent.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine

title: Section 376AB - Rape on woman under twelve years of age
content: This section provides specific punishment for rape committed on a woman under twelve years of age.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment of not less than 20 years, which may extend to life imprisonment (meaning imprisonment for the remainder of natural life), and fine

title: Section 376B - Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation
content: This section punishes a husband for having sexual intercourse with his wife without her consent while they are living separately under a judicial separation decree.. Punishment: Imprisonment from 2 to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 376C - Sexual intercourse by a person in authority
content: This section punishes a person in authority (like a public servant, superintendent of a jail, hospital, etc.) for having sexual intercourse with a woman in their custody by using their position of authority.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment from 5 to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 376D - Gang rape
content: This section punishes the offence of gang rape, where a woman is raped by one or more persons constituting a group acting in furtherance of a common intention.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment of not less than 20 years, which may extend to life imprisonment (meaning imprisonment for the remainder of natural life), and fine

title: Section 376DA - Gang rape on woman under sixteen years of age
content: This section provides specific punishment for gang rape committed on a woman under sixteen years of age.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life (meaning imprisonment for the remainder of natural life), and fine

title: Section 376DB - Gang rape on woman under twelve years of age
content: This section provides specific punishment for gang rape committed on a woman under twelve years of age.. Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life (meaning imprisonment for the remainder of natural life), and fine

title: Section 376E - Punishment for repeat offenders
content: This section provides for enhanced punishment for a person who has been previously convicted for the offence of rape and is subsequently convicted of rape again.. Punishment: Punishment of imprisonment for life (meaning imprisonment for the remainder of natural life), or death.

title: Section 377 - Unnatural offences
content: This section punishes voluntary carnal intercourse against the order of nature with any man, woman, or animal. (Note: The application of this section to consensual acts between adults has been read down by the Supreme Court).. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 378 - Theft
content: This section defines the offence of 'Theft'. It involves dishonestly taking any movable property out of the possession of any person without their consent, with the intention of taking it dishonestly.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.379)

title: Section 379 - Punishment for theft
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of theft, as defined in S.378.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 380 - Theft in dwelling house, etc.
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for theft committed in any building, tent, or vessel used as a human dwelling, or for the custody of property.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 381 - Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for theft committed by a clerk or servant of property that was in the possession of their master or employer.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 382 - Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint in order to the committing of the theft
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for theft if the thief has made preparations to cause death, hurt, or restraint to any person in order to commit the theft, or to effect their escape after the theft.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 383 - Extortion
content: This section defines 'Extortion'. It is intentionally putting any person in fear of injury to themselves or another, and thereby dishonestly inducing them to deliver any property or valuable security.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.384)

title: Section 384 - Punishment for extortion
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of extortion, as defined in S.383.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 385 - Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion
content: This section punishes an attempt to commit extortion by putting any person in fear of injury.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 386 - Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 387 - Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
content: This section punishes putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion, even if the extortion is not completed.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 388 - Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death, etc.
content: This section punishes extortion by threatening to accuse another person of an offence punishable with death, life imprisonment, or imprisonment for up to 10 years.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 389 - Putting person in fear of accusation of offence, in order to commit extortion
content: This section punishes putting a person in fear of an accusation of a serious offence in order to commit extortion, even if the extortion is not completed.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 390 - Robbery
content: This section defines 'Robbery'. In all robbery there is either theft or extortion. Theft becomes robbery if, to commit the theft or while carrying away property, the offender causes or attempts to cause death/hurt/wrongful restraint, or fear of instant death/hurt/restraint. Extortion is robbery if the offender is in the presence of the person put in fear and extorts by putting them in fear of instant hurt.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.392)

title: Section 391 - Dacoity
content: This section defines 'Dacoity'. When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit a robbery, it is called dacoity.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.395)

title: Section 392 - Punishment for robbery
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of robbery, as defined in S.390.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine (If committed on highway between sunset and sunrise, imprisonment up to 14 years)

title: Section 393 - Attempt to commit robbery
content: This section punishes an attempt to commit robbery.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 394 - Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
content: This section punishes voluntarily causing hurt while committing or attempting to commit robbery. If several persons commit robbery and one causes hurt, all are guilty under this section.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 395 - Punishment for dacoity
content: This section provides the punishment for the offence of dacoity, as defined in S.391.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 396 - Dacoity with murder
content: This section punishes dacoity if any one of the dacoits commits murder in the course of that dacoity. Every member of the gang is guilty of this offence.. Punishment: Death, or Imprisonment for life, and fine

title: Section 397 - Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for robbery or dacoity if, at the time of committing it, the offender uses a deadly weapon, or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 7 years

title: Section 398 - Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
content: This section punishes an attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when the offender is armed with any deadly weapon.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 7 years

title: Section 399 - Making preparation to commit dacoity
content: This section punishes making any preparation to commit dacoity.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 400 - Punishment for belonging to gang of dacoits
content: This section punishes belonging to a gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing dacoity.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 401 - Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves
content: This section punishes belonging to a gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing theft.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 402 - Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity
content: This section punishes being one of five or more persons assembled for the purpose of committing dacoity.. Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 403 - Dishonest misappropriation of property
content: This section defines and punishes the offence of dishonest misappropriation of movable property. It involves converting another's property to one's own use, even if it came into one's possession legitimately, but without the right to do so.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 404 - Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death
content: This section punishes dishonest misappropriation of property that was in the possession of a deceased person at the time of their death. It is considered a violation of trust towards the deceased and their heirs.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine (If offender was employed by the deceased, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine)

title: Section 405 - Criminal breach of trust
content: This section defines 'Criminal Breach of Trust'. It occurs when a person entrusted with property or dominion over property, dishonestly misappropriates, converts, uses, or disposes of that property in violation of law or legal contract.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.406)

title: Section 406 - Punishment for criminal breach of trust
content: This section provides the punishment for the general offence of criminal breach of trust, as defined in S.405.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 407 - Criminal breach of trust by carrier, etc.
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for criminal breach of trust committed by a carrier, wharfinger, or warehouse-keeper. These persons are entrusted with goods for transportation or storage as part of their profession.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 408 - Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for criminal breach of trust committed by a clerk or servant. This targets employees who are entrusted with property by their employer.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 409 - Criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant or agent
content: This section provides the most severe punishment for criminal breach of trust. It applies to public servants, bankers, merchants, factors (agents), brokers, attorneys, or other agents. It involves a high degree of trust.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 410 - Stolen property
content: This section defines the term 'Stolen Property' for the purposes of the following sections. It includes property obtained not only by theft but also by extortion, robbery, dacoity, and criminal misappropriation.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive)

title: Section 411 - Dishonestly receiving stolen property
content: This section punishes dishonestly receiving or retaining stolen property, knowing or having reason to believe it is stolen property.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 412 - Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for receiving property that was stolen during the commission of a dacoity, knowing it to be such.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 413 - Habitually dealing in stolen property
content: This section punishes habitually receiving and dealing in stolen property. It targets fences who make a business of trading in stolen goods.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 414 - Assisting in concealment or disposal of stolen property
content: This section punishes voluntarily assisting in concealing or disposing of stolen property, knowing it to be stolen.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 415 - Cheating
content: This section defines the offence of 'Cheating'. It involves deceiving a person (fraudulently or dishonestly inducing them to deliver property, or to consent to retaining property) or intentionally inducing them to do or omit something which causes damage/harm.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.417)

title: Section 416 - Cheating by personation
content: This section defines 'Cheating by Personation'. It is a specific form of cheating where a person cheats by pretending to be some other person, or by knowingly substituting one person for another.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.419)

title: Section 417 - Punishment for cheating
content: This section provides the punishment for the general offence of cheating, as defined in S.415.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 418 - Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to person whose interest offender is bound to protect
content: This section punishes cheating where the offender knew that the act was likely to cause wrongful loss to a person whose interest they were bound, either by law or contract, to protect.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 419 - Punishment for cheating by personation
content: This section provides the punishment for the specific offence of cheating by personation, as defined in S.416.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 420 - Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for cheating where the deception is dishonest and induces the victim to deliver any property or alter valuable security. This is the most commonly used section for serious fraud.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 421 - Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
content: This section punishes dishonestly or fraudulently removing, concealing, or transferring property to prevent it from being distributed among one's creditors as required by law.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 422 - Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors
content: This section punishes dishonestly or fraudulently preventing any debt or demand from being available for one's creditors.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 423 - Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration
content: This section punishes dishonestly or fraudulently signing or executing a deed or document related to the transfer of property that contains a false statement regarding the consideration (price) or the property itself.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 424 - Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
content: This section is a general provision that punishes dishonestly or fraudulently concealing or removing any property, or assisting in doing so. It is a broader version of S.421.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 425 - Mischief
content: This section defines the offence of 'Mischief'. It involves intentionally causing the destruction of property, or any change that destroys or diminishes its value or utility, or causes damage.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.426)

title: Section 426 - Punishment for mischief
content: This section provides the punishment for the general offence of mischief, as defined in S.425.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both

title: Section 427 - Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for mischief that causes damage or loss amounting to fifty rupees or more. (Note: The amount is symbolic; courts consider current value).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 428 - Mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless any animal of the value of ten rupees
content: This section punishes mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming, or rendering useless any animal worth ten rupees or more. (Note: The amount is symbolic).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 429 - Mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless any animal of the value of fifty rupees
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for the same acts as S.428 if the animal is worth fifty rupees or more, or is a camel, horse, etc.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 430 - Mischief by injury to works of irrigation or by wrongfully diverting water
content: This section punishes mischief by causing injury to any irrigation works, or wrongfully diverting water, thereby causing damage or loss.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 431 - Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river or channel
content: This section punishes mischief by causing injury to any public road, bridge, navigable river, or channel, rendering it impassable or less safe for travel or transport.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 432 - Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage
content: This section punishes mischief by causing an inundation (flood) or obstruction to any public drainage, where damage is caused.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 433 - Mischief by destroying, moving or rendering less useful a light-house or sea-mark
content: This section punishes mischief by destroying, moving, or diminishing the usefulness of any light-house or sea-mark used for navigation.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both

title: Section 434 - Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a land-mark fixed by public authority
content: This section punishes mischief by destroying, moving, or defacing a land-mark (e.g., a survey marker, boundary stone) set up by public authority.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

title: Section 435 - Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage to amount of one hundred or (in case of agricultural produce) ten rupees
content: This section punishes mischief by fire or explosive substance intended to cause, or knowing it to be likely to cause, damage of one hundred rupees or more (or ten rupees for agricultural produce).. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine

title: Section 436 - Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc.
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for mischief by fire or explosive substance with the intention of destroying any building used as a human dwelling, or place of worship, etc.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 437 - Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden
content: This section punishes mischief with the intention of destroying or rendering unsafe any decked vessel or a vessel of twenty tons burden.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 438 - Punishment for the mischief described in section 437 committed by fire or any explosive substance
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for committing the mischief described in S.437 by means of fire or an explosive substance.. Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 439 - Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.
content: This section punishes intentionally running a vessel aground or ashore with the intention of committing theft, criminal misappropriation, or dishonestly receiving stolen property from the vessel.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine

title: Section 440 - Mischief committed after preparation made for causing death or hurt
content: This section provides enhanced punishment for mischief if it is committed after preparation has been made for causing death, hurt, or restraint to any person to commit the mischief or to escape afterwards.. Punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine

title: Section 441 - Criminal trespass
content: This section defines 'Criminal Trespass'. It involves entering or remaining on another's property with the intention to commit an offence, or to intimidate, insult, or annoy the person in possession of the property.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.447)

title: Section 442 - House-trespass
content: This section defines 'House-Trespass'. It is a form of criminal trespass where the trespass involves entering or remaining in any building, tent, or vessel used as a human dwelling.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.448)

title: Section 443 - Lurking house-trespass
content: This section defines 'Lurking House-Trespass'. It is a form of house-trespass where the offender takes precautions to conceal themselves from the person entitled to exclude them.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.453)

title: Section 444 - Lurking house-trespass by night
content: This section defines 'Lurking House-Trespass by Night'. It is lurking house-trespass committed after sunset and before sunrise.. Punishment: N/A (Interpretive - Element for S.456)

title: Section 445 - House-breaking
content: This section defines 'House-Breaking'.
